qas.question: When was the samurai military modernized?
Where did Japan open a military school in 1855?
What kind of military school did Japan open in 1855?
What nationality of engineers did Japan hire to build naval arsenals?
How many steam warships did Japan have in 1867?

context: From <a0_0>1854<a0_0/>, the samurai army and the navy were modernized. A <a2_0>Naval<a2_0/> training school was established in <a1_0>Nagasaki<a1_0/> in 1855. Naval students were sent to study in Western naval schools for several years, starting a <a3_0>tradition<a3_0/> of foreign-educated future leaders, such as Admiral Enomoto. French naval engineers were hired to build naval arsenals, such as Yokosuka and Nagasaki. By the end of the Tokugawa shogunate in 1867, the Japanese navy of the shogun already possessed <a4_0>eight<a4_0/> western-style steam warships around the flagship Kaiyō Maru, which were used against pro-imperial forces during the Boshin war, under the command of Admiral Enomoto. A French Military Mission to Japan (1867) was established to help modernize the armies of the Bakufu.
